headline: Philip Morris International (NYSE:PM) Margin Dip Reinforces Bearish Narrative on Profitability Trends
summary: Philip Morris International (PM) reported a net profit margin of 21%, down from 24.1% the year prior. Recent earnings growth has been negative for the past year, with a 1.3% average annual earnings decline over the last five years. Shares are currently trading below both estimated fair value and analyst price targets as the market weighs a forecasted 8.75% annual earnings growth and 7.8% revenue growth. Both figures trail the broader US market’s 10.1% average. Investors are watching a...

headline: Stocks to Watch Tuesday Recap: Warner Bros. Discovery, GM, GE Aerospace
summary: ↗️ Warner Bros. Discovery (WBD): The media company said it had begun reviewing strategic alternatives after being approached about potential deals. Shares jumped nearly 11%. ↗️ RTX (RTX): The defense company raised its annual forecast on high demand for munitions and missiles.

headline: Gold and precious metals pull back, Philip Morris stock drops
summary: Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including precious metals gold (GC=F), silver (SI=F), and platinum (PL=F) falling after President Trump announces his cooperation in working with China to reach a trade deal, Phillip Morris (PM) shares also dropping, and Cleveland-Cliffs (CLF) receiving a downgrade. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Market Movers: GM shares pop in the premarket
summary: A slew of Q3 earnings report were released before the opening bell on Wall Street. GM (GM) led the way as it raised its full-year guidance. Coca-Cola (KO), GE Aerospace (GE) and Philip Morris (PM) also impressed investors. For more live coverage of markets watch the full episode of Market Sunrise and head to Yahoo Finance.

headline: Philip Morris lifts annual profit outlook amid solid heated tobacco demand

headline: Philip Morris’s (NYSE:PM) Q3 Sales Top Estimates
summary: Tobacco company Philip Morris International (NYSE:PM) reported Q3 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 9.4% year on year to $10.85 billion. Its GAAP profit of $2.23 per share was 12.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

content.title: Philip Morris’s (NYSE:PM) Q3 Sales Top Estimates
content.summary: Tobacco company Philip Morris International (NYSE:PM) reported Q3 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 9.4% year on year to $10.85 billion. Its GAAP profit of $2.23 per share was 12.5% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Philip Morris: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: PM) on Tuesday reported third-quarter net income of $3.48 billion. The Stamford, Connecticut-based company said it had net income of $2.23 per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were $2.24 per share.

content.title: Philip Morris: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
content.summary: PM) on Tuesday reported third-quarter net income of $3.48 billion. The Stamford, Connecticut-based company said it had net income of $2.23 per share. Earnings, adjusted for one-time gains and costs, were $2.24 per share.

headline: Inflation Data; Intel and Tesla Earnings: What to Watch This Week
